definitions.example: Now that I know it's taken care of, I can rest easy at night.
It's often easy to wake up but hard to get up.

definitions.definition: Causing ease; giving comfort, or freedom from care or labour.
definitions.example: Rich people live in easy circumstances.

definitions.definition: Free from constraint, harshness, or formality; unconstrained; smooth.
(of a woman) Consenting readily to sex.
definitions.example: She has a reputation for being easy; they say she slept with half the senior class.

definitions.definition: Not making resistance or showing unwillingness; tractable; yielding; compliant.
Not straitened as to money matters; opposed to tight.
In a relaxed or casual manner.
definitions.example: After his illness, John decided to take it easy.

definitions.definition: In a manner without strictness or harshness.
definitions.example: Jane went easier on him after he broke his arm.

definitions.definition: Used an intensifier for large magnitudes.
definitions.example: This project will cost 15 million dollars, easy.
